title: Falafel with Canned Chickpeas Recipe
description: Falafel made with canned chickpeas, onion, bread crumbs, herbs and spices; simply delicious, restaurant-quality, falafel in just 30 minutes.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Everyday Cooking Vegetarian Falafel with Canned Chickpeas 4.9 (39) 37 Reviews 8 Photos Falafel made with canned chickpeas — just like the ones you taste in a Greek restaurant! This recipe makes about 12 patties. Serve with hummus or tzatziki sauce. Submitted by Dani Updated on October 5, 2023 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 8 8 8 8 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Total Time: 35 mins Servings: 12 Yield: 12 patties Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings 1 ½ (15 ounce) cans chickpeas, drained 1 ½ onions, chopped ¾ cup chopped fresh parsley 3 cloves garlic, chopped 2 eggs 1 tablespoon ground cumin 1 ½ teaspoons ground coriander 1 ½ teaspoons salt 1 ½ teaspoons lemon juice 1 ½ teaspoons baking powder 1 pinch ground black pepper, or to taste 1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste 1 ½ cups bread crumbs 1 tablespoon olive oil, or as needed Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Mash chickpeas in a bowl using a masher. Combine mashed chickpeas, onions, parsley, and garlic in a blender; blend until smooth. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Mix eggs, cumin, coriander, salt, lemon juice, baking powder, black pepper, and cayenne together in a bowl. Add chickpea mixture and mix together. Add bread crumbs slowly and combine using your hands until mixture will hold together when frying. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Form mixture into twelve 3-inch diameter patties. Fry patties in hot oil until browned, 3 to 4 minutes per side. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print Nutrition Facts (per serving) 134 Calories 3g Fat 22g Carbs 5g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 12 Calories 134 % Daily Value * Total Fat 3g 4% Saturated Fat 1g 3% Cholesterol 31mg 10% Sodium 571mg 25% Total Carbohydrate 22g 8% Dietary Fiber 3g 11% Total Sugars 2g Protein 5g 10% Vitamin C 9mg 10% Calcium 94mg 7% Iron 2mg 11% Potassium 174mg 4% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Falafel with Canned Chickpeas 01 of 08 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 08 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02/05/2025 Great flavors I baked mine after mashing it into patties, 375 Fahrenheit for 8-10 minutes on each side or til browned. delicious! 03 of 08 Photo by  QuickGouda7110 08/13/2023 The BEST recipe yet! I added a pinch of Smoke Paprika and used only half the salt. Brushed with olive oil and pit in Air Fryer at 375⁰ for 14 minutes. Perfect! 04 of 08 Photo by  maemie 02/06/2022 This was delicious and easy. Made this on a whim, my husband wants me to plan a dinner around this falafel. All I added was a tsp of tahini, subbed apple cider vinegar for lemon, and added paprika. Pan seared and finished in the air fryer. 05 of 08 Photo by  carolinenoyes 10/15/2021 06 of 08 Photo by  SammyD 07/27/2021 Loved this recipe! Garlic is slightly overwhelming I will do one clove less next time. This turned out beautiful I will be doing this again and again and again! Thank you for the recipe!! 07 of 08 Photo by  Soumya Gupta 04/01/2020 I followed the recipe using metric measurements and it turned out perfectly. With metric measurements I was able to be more accurate. The falafel tastes good in a sandwich or solo treats! During this quarantine, I only had canned chickpeas so this recipe was PERFECT! 08 of 08 Photo by  Soumya Gupta 04/01/2020 I followed the recipe using metric measurements and it turned out perfectly. With metric measurements I was able to be more accurate. The falafel tastes good in a sandwich or solo treats! During this quarantine, I only had canned chickpeas so this recipe was PERFECT! 1 You’ll Also Love Air Fryer Falafel 5 Ratings Campfire Curried Vegetable Packs Garbanzo Stir-Fry 212 Ratings Falafel Dough Pizza 1 Rating Mexicana Veggie Burgers 4 Ratings Black Beans and Rice 1,347 Ratings Black Bean and Soy Veggie Burgers 3 Ratings Southwestern Vegetarian Pasta 130 Ratings Ta'ameya (Egyptian Falafel) 16 Ratings Unsloppy Joes 316 Ratings Vegan Bean Taco Filling 434 Ratings Quinoa Veggie Burgers 5 Ratings Chickpea Vegetarian Meatballs 20 Ratings Air Fryer Vegetarian Cauliflower and Chickpea Tacos 10 Ratings Vegetarian Sloppy Joe 2 Ratings Braised Kale and Beans 1 Rating Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
